content: 1 emma roll neck cat sweater catventurous crochet thank you for downloading the written pattern for our emma roll neck cat sweater we really appreciate your support this pattern includes a detailed written pattern as well as an abbreviated version on pages 11 and 12 you can view the accompanying video tutorial free of charge on the catventurous crochet youtube channel corresponding timestamps on the video tutorial are indicated in this pattern in brackets the emma roll neck cat sweater has catventurers cats who go outside on leash in mind and allows for a harness beneath and a leash to be passed through the natural gaps in the stitches on the back charlotte & melba wish you happy crocheting important these sweaters are intended to be practical and fun for you and your cat for their safety please supervise your cat at all times while they are wearing this sweater or any other item that secures around the neck or within which claws may become entangled please never use our patterns to make your cat hate you reward your meowdel with tasty and healthy treats supermeowdel catventurer melba @catventurepussmelba 2 crochet skill level beginners with some experience and above certain sizing requirements may require advanced beginner skills materials 0 30 yarn of your choice i used 5 - 6 weight acrylic/nylon and acrylic/wool blends suits bulky yarns crochet hook to suit your yarn i used 5 5mm darning/yarn needle scissors measuring tape stitch markers optional stitches/techniques 2 10 slip knot onto hook making a chain chain single_crochet single_crochet single_crochet into the back loop only single_crochet blo single_crochet decrease single_crochet decrease optional slip_stitch sl st triple crochet tc triple crochet increase tc increase triple crochet decrease tc decrease tying on invisible finishing stitch optional weaving in ends disguising a seam with a backwards sl st optional sizing a garment note all stitch terms are in us/australian terminology if you are unfamiliar with any of these stitches or techniques please refer to any references you have available to assist you before beginning this project 3 notes on sizing the sizing for this sweater is fully customisable and there are instructions throughout on how you can size it to fit your individual cat so that it will not restrict movement please use these notes as well as the instructions within this pattern about sizing as a guide please make the necessary adjustments to your work to suit the size and proportions of your individual cat in general it is more favourable to err on the slightly larger side than the smaller side with this pattern i recommend that if possible you try your unfinished sweater on your cat at regular points as you make it you can begin sizing by measuring your cat s neck circumference but other measurements that are helpful are width across chest from leg to leg circumference around ribs behind front legs length from neck to where you want the sweater to fall on the back length from behind
